section.title: Past Simple and Past Continuous
section.sectiontitle: Use the Past Simple for complete, finished actions in the past. Use the Past Continuous for temporary actions and situations in the past. Make the Past Continuous with was/were + -ing.
section.text1: I stayed in Jack's house for eight weeks.
section.text1a: I was staying in Jack's house last winter.
section.text2: She studied medicine for six years.
section.sectiontitle2: When the Past Continuous and the Past Simple are used together, the Past Continuous refers to the longer, background action. The Past Simple describes the short, main action.
section.text3a: He was sleeping when the telephone rang.
section.text4a: We were watching TV when we heard the explosion.

section.title: Past Simple and Past Continuous
section.sectiontitle: Use the Past Continuous to talk about what was happening at a particular past moment.
section.text1a: At six o'clock last night I was writing an email.
section.text2a: They were playing tennis at seven o'clock.
